name: Successful Registration
preconditions: User is not logged in. No account exists for the test email address. Browser localStorage is clear of `auth_token` and `refresh_token`.
steps: Navigate to `http://localhost:5173/` (the landing page).
Locate and click the "Start Here" call-to-action button.
Verify the authentication dialog opens and the registration form is displayed (fields: email, password, confirm password).
Enter a valid, unused email address in the email field (e.g., `testuser_001@example.com`).
Enter a valid password that meets all requirements: minimum 8 characters, at least 1 letter, at least 1 digit, and at least 1 symbol (e.g., `TestPass1!`).
Enter the same password in the confirm password field.
Click the "Register" (or equivalent submit) button.
Wait for the request to complete.
expected:
- The registration request succeeds (no error messages displayed).
- The user is automatically logged in and redirected to `/engage` (the main dashboard).
- Opening the browser developer tools and inspecting `localStorage` shows both `auth_token` and `refresh_token` keys present with non-empty JWT string values.
- The dashboard layout is visible (sidebar, top navigation, inbox or default view).

expected:

- No HTTP request is sent to the backend (verify in the Network tab of developer tools).
- The user remains on the registration form.

name: Proactive Token Refresh Before Expiry
preconditions: User is logged in. Both `auth_token` and `refresh_token` are present in localStorage. The httpApi interceptor is configured to refresh tokens when the auth_token expires within 60 seconds.
steps: Log in to the application with valid credentials.
Open browser developer tools, go to the Application tab, and locate `auth_token` in localStorage.
Decode the JWT `auth_token` (use a tool like jwt.io or a browser extension) and note the `exp` (expiration) claim timestamp.

Manually modify the `auth_token` in localStorage to simulate near-expiry: replace it with a token whose `exp` is within the next 60 seconds. Alternatively, wait until the token is within 60 seconds of expiry (if feasible in the test environment).
Trigger an API call by performing an action in the app (e.g., navigate to Inbox, which fetches stuff items).
Open the Network tab in developer tools and observe the HTTP requests.
expected:
- Before the main API call is sent, the httpApi interceptor detects the token is within 60 seconds of expiry.
- An automatic request is made to the token refresh endpoint (`POST /v1/user/refresh`) using the `refresh_token`.
- The refresh endpoint returns new tokens.
- The `auth_token` and `refresh_token` in localStorage are updated with the new values.
- The original API call proceeds with the new `auth_token` in the Authorization header and succeeds.
- The user experiences no interruption or error.

Add a comment and verify it appears in the list.
Navigate to the detail page of an action.
Verify the comments section is present with the "Add a comment..." placeholder.
Add a comment and verify it appears in the list.
Navigate to the detail page of a project.
Verify the comments section is present with the "Add a comment..." placeholder.
Add a comment and verify it appears in the list.
expected: The comments section is present and fully functional on all three detail page types: Stuff detail, Action detail, and Project detail. Adding, displaying, and all comment behaviors work identically across all detail types.

name: Comment with Maximum Length
preconditions: User is logged in. An item detail page is open.
steps: Click on the "Add a comment..." placeholder to expand the textarea.
Paste or type exactly 2000 characters of text.
Verify the character counter displays "2000 / 2000".
Verify the counter is displayed in red (at the threshold).
Verify the "Save" button is still enabled.
Click "Save".
Verify the comment is saved successfully and appears in the list.
Click on the placeholder again to expand the textarea.
Paste or type exactly 2001 characters of text.
Verify the character counter displays "2001 / 2000" in red.
Verify the "Save" button is disabled.
expected: A comment with exactly 2000 characters can be saved successfully. At 2001 characters, the Save button is disabled. The boundary is strictly enforced at 2000 characters.

name: Comment Empty Save Prevention
preconditions: User is logged in. An item detail page is open.
steps: Click on the "Add a comment..." placeholder to expand the textarea.
Do not type any text (leave the textarea empty).
Observe the "Save" button state.
Verify the "Save" button is disabled.
Click the "Save" button (if clickable despite being disabled).
Verify no empty comment is added to the list.
Type a single space character.
Verify the "Save" button remains disabled (whitespace-only should not be accepted).
Type a valid character (e.g., "A").
Verify the "Save" button becomes enabled.
expected: The Save button is disabled when the textarea is empty or contains only whitespace. No empty or whitespace-only comments can be submitted. The Save button enables only when at least one non-whitespace character is present.

name: Settings Page Loads
preconditions: User is logged in.
steps: Navigate to /settings via the browser URL bar or a settings link in the application.
Wait for the page to fully load.
Verify the Account section is visible (showing email, change password option).
Verify the Sessions section is visible (showing active sessions list).
Verify the Application section is visible (showing new items position setting).
Verify the Tags section is visible (showing quick-add presets).
Verify the Calendar section is visible (showing week start, time format, business hours, business days).
Verify the Review section is visible (showing weekly review toggle).
Verify the About section is visible (showing version and debug mode toggle).
expected: The settings page loads completely with all sections visible: Account, Sessions, Application, Tags, Calendar, Review, and About. No loading errors occur.

name: Settings Auto-Save
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Week starts on" setting in the Calendar section.
Change the value (e.g., from Monday to Sunday).
Observe the control immediately after changing it.
Verify a spinning overlay or indicator appears on or near the control.
Verify pointer events are disabled on the control during the save (the control should not respond to additional clicks).
Wait for the save to complete (spinner disappears).
Refresh the page.
Verify the setting persists with the new value.
expected: Changing any setting triggers an immediate auto-save. A spinning overlay appears on the control during the save, and pointer events are disabled to prevent double-changes. After the save completes, the spinner disappears and the control becomes interactive again. The setting persists across page refreshes.

name: Settings Offline Fallback
preconditions: User is logged in. The user has previously visited /settings so localStorage contains cached settings.
steps: Open browser developer tools and go to the Network tab.
Simulate a slow network connection (e.g., throttle to "Slow 3G").
Navigate to /settings.
Observe the page immediately upon navigation.
Verify the settings values appear instantly from localStorage cache (no loading spinner for the entire page).
Wait for the API response to arrive.
Verify the settings values update if the API response contains different values than the cached ones.
Disable network throttling.
expected: Settings load immediately from localStorage, providing instant display without waiting for the API. When the API response arrives, any differences overwrite the cached values. The user sees no blank or loading state for the settings values.

name: Account - Email Display
preconditions: User is logged in with a known email address (e.g., testuser@example.com).
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Account section.
Verify the user's email address is displayed (e.g., "testuser@example.com").
Verify the email is displayed as read-only text (not an editable input field).
Attempt to click on the email text.
Verify no edit mode or input field appears.
expected: The user's email is displayed as read-only text in the Account section. It cannot be edited or modified from this page.

name: Change Password - Open Modal
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Change password" button or link in the Account section.
Click the "Change password" button.
Verify a modal dialog opens.
On desktop, verify the modal is centered on the screen with a maximum width of approximately 400px.
On mobile (or using device emulation), verify the modal opens as a full-screen overlay.
Verify the modal contains fields for: Current password, New password, Confirm new password.
Verify the modal has Submit and Cancel buttons.
expected: Clicking "Change password" opens a modal dialog. On desktop it is centered with a max width of 400px. On mobile it is full-screen. The modal contains the required password fields and action buttons.

name: Change Password - Success
preconditions: User is logged in. The change password modal is open. The user knows their current password.
steps: Open the change password modal.
Enter the correct current password in the "Current password" field.
Enter a valid new password that meets requirements in the "New password" field (e.g., "NewP@ssw0rd123").
Enter the same new password in the "Confirm new password" field.
Click the "Submit" or "Change Password" button.
Wait for the server response.
Verify a success message is displayed.
Verify the success message includes the count of revoked sessions (e.g., "Password changed. 2 other sessions have been revoked.").
Verify the modal closes.
expected: The password is changed successfully. A success message is displayed that includes the number of revoked sessions. The modal closes. The user can log in with the new password.

name: Change Password - Wrong Current Password
preconditions: User is logged in. The change password modal is open.
steps: Open the change password modal.
Enter an incorrect current password in the "Current password" field (e.g., "WrongPassword123").
Enter a valid new password in the "New password" field.
Enter the matching new password in the "Confirm new password" field.
Click the "Submit" or "Change Password" button.
Wait for the server response.
Verify an error message is displayed stating "Current password is incorrect" or similar.
Verify the modal remains open.
Verify the user can correct the current password and retry.
expected: The server returns HTTP 401. An error message "Current password is incorrect" is displayed. The modal stays open for the user to retry with the correct current password.

name: Change Password - Weak New Password
preconditions: User is logged in. The change password modal is open.
steps: Open the change password modal.
Enter the correct current password in the "Current password" field.
Enter a weak new password that does not meet requirements in the "New password" field (e.g., "123").
Enter the same weak password in the "Confirm new password" field.
Click the "Submit" or "Change Password" button.
Wait for the server response.
Verify an error message is displayed stating "New password does not meet requirements" or similar.
Verify the modal remains open.
expected: The server returns HTTP 400. An error message "New password does not meet requirements" is displayed. The modal stays open for the user to enter a stronger password.

name: Sessions - List Display
preconditions: User is logged in with at least two active sessions (e.g., logged in from both a desktop browser and a mobile device).
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Sessions section.
Verify a list of active sessions is displayed.

For each session, verify the following information is shown: a. A device icon (phone emoji for mobile, laptop emoji for desktop). b. The device name or browser/OS description. c. The IP address of the session. d. The "last active" time (relative or absolute timestamp).
Verify all known active sessions are listed.
expected: All active sessions are displayed in a list. Each session entry shows a device icon (phone or laptop emoji), device name, IP address, and last active time.

name: Sessions - Current Session Badge
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open with the Sessions section visible.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Sessions section.
Identify the session entry corresponding to the current browser session.
Verify it is marked with a "Current" badge or label that visually distinguishes it from other sessions.
Verify no other session entries have the "Current" badge.
expected: The current session is clearly marked with a "Current" badge. Only one session has this badge, and it corresponds to the browser/device currently being used.

name: Sessions - End Current Session
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open with the Sessions section visible.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the current session entry (marked with "Current" badge).
Click the "End" button on the current session.
Verify a confirmation dialog appears warning that ending the current session will log the user out.
Click "Confirm" or the equivalent confirmation button.
Verify the user is logged out.
Verify the browser redirects to /login.
expected: Clicking "End" on the current session shows a confirmation dialog. Confirming logs the user out and redirects them to the /login page.

name: Sessions - End Other Session
preconditions: User is logged in with at least two active sessions. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate a session entry that is NOT marked as "Current".
Click the "End" button on that session.
Verify a confirmation dialog appears with a message indicating the session "will be signed out within the next hour" or similar.
Click "Confirm" or the equivalent confirmation button.
Verify the session is removed from the list.
Verify the current session remains active (the user is not logged out).
On the other device/browser, verify the session is eventually invalidated (within the stated timeframe).
expected: Clicking "End" on another session shows a confirmation dialog mentioning the delayed sign-out. Confirming removes the session from the list immediately. The current session remains unaffected. The other session is revoked server-side.

name: Sessions - End Others Bulk Action
preconditions: User is logged in with at least three active sessions. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Sessions section.
Count the number of sessions listed (e.g., 3 sessions).
Verify an "End Others" button is visible (should appear when more than 1 session exists).
Click the "End Others" button.
Verify a confirmation dialog appears mentioning the count of sessions that will be ended (e.g., "End 2 other sessions?").
Click "Confirm" or the equivalent confirmation button.
Verify all sessions except the current one are removed from the list.
Verify only the current session (with "Current" badge) remains.
Verify the user is NOT logged out.
expected: The "End Others" button triggers a confirmation dialog showing the count of sessions to be revoked. Confirming removes all sessions except the current one. The user remains logged in.

name: Sessions - Error State
preconditions: User is logged in. The sessions API endpoint is temporarily unavailable or returns an error.
steps: Simulate a network failure or server error for the sessions API endpoint (e.g., block the request in DevTools or configure the server to return HTTP 500).
Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Sessions section.
Verify an error message is displayed (e.g., "Failed to load sessions" or similar).
Verify a "Retry" button is displayed alongside the error message.
Restore the network connection or server functionality.
Click the "Retry" button.
Verify the sessions list loads successfully.
expected: When sessions fail to load, an error message and a "Retry" button are displayed instead of the sessions list. Clicking "Retry" attempts to reload the sessions and succeeds when the service is available.

name: Application - New Items Position
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "New items position" setting in the Application section.
Set the value to "End".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to /inbox.
Add a new stuff item via Quick Add or the inbox input.
Verify the new item appears at the end (bottom) of the list.
Navigate back to /settings.
Change the "New items position" setting to "Beginning".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to /inbox.
Add another new stuff item.
Verify the new item appears at the beginning (top) of the list.
expected: When set to "End", new items appear at the bottom of lists. When set to "Beginning", new items appear at the top of lists. The setting applies consistently across inbox, next actions, and other list views.

name: Tags - Quick-Add Presets
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the Tags section.
Verify default tag presets are displayed as read-only chips (e.g., common GTD context tags).
Click on the tag presets area to edit.
Verify a TagInput component appears (or the chips become editable), allowing the user to add and remove tags.
Add a new tag by typing a tag name and pressing Comma or Enter.
Verify the new tag appears as a chip.
Remove an existing tag by clicking its remove (X) button.
Click outside the TagInput area (focus-out / blur).
Verify the changes are saved automatically.
Refresh the page and verify the updated tags persist.
expected: Tag presets are displayed as read-only chips. Clicking activates the TagInput editor. Tags can be added (via comma or Enter) and removed (via X button). Blurring the input triggers an auto-save. Changes persist across page refreshes.

name: Calendar - Week Starts On
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open. The user has access to the calendar view.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Week starts on" setting in the Calendar section.
Set the value to "Monday".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page.
Verify the calendar displays Monday as the first day of the week.
Navigate back to /settings.
Change the "Week starts on" setting to "Sunday".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page.
Verify the calendar displays Sunday as the first day of the week.
expected: The calendar view updates to reflect the selected first day of the week. Monday-start shows Mon-Sun ordering. Sunday-start shows Sun-Sat ordering.

name: Calendar - Time Format
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open. The user has actions with specific times on the calendar.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Time format" setting in the Calendar section.
Set the value to "24h".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page.
Verify all time displays use 24-hour format (e.g., "14:00" instead of "2:00 PM").
Navigate back to /settings.
Change the "Time format" setting to "12h".
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page.
Verify all time displays use 12-hour format with AM/PM (e.g., "2:00 PM" instead of "14:00").
expected: Time displays throughout the calendar and time-related UI elements switch between 24-hour and 12-hour format based on the setting.

name: Calendar - Business Hours
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Business hours" setting in the Calendar section.
Set the start hour to 9 and the end hour to 17 (9 AM to 5 PM).
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page (day or week view).
Verify hours 9:00 through 17:00 are visually highlighted or distinguished from non-business hours.
Verify hours outside this range (e.g., 6:00-8:59 and 17:01-22:00) are not highlighted.
Navigate back to /settings.
Change business hours to 8 start, 18 end.
Navigate to the Calendar page.
Verify the highlighted range updates to 8:00-18:00.
expected: Business hours are visually highlighted in the calendar day/week view. The highlighted range matches the configured start and end hours. Non-business hours are visually distinct (e.g., dimmer or different background).

name: Calendar - Business Days
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Business days" setting in the Calendar section.
Verify day buttons are displayed for each day of the week (Mon-Sun or Sun-Sat).
Click on "Saturday" to select it as a business day (if not already selected).
Verify the "Saturday" button becomes highlighted (e.g., blue background).
Click on "Sunday" to deselect it as a business day (if currently selected).
Verify the "Sunday" button becomes un-highlighted.
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Navigate to the Calendar page (week view).
Verify Saturday is displayed with business-day styling and Sunday with non-business-day styling.
expected: Business day buttons toggle on click. Selected days are highlighted in blue. Deselected days are un-highlighted. The calendar view reflects the selected business days with appropriate visual styling.

name: Review Toggle
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the "Weekly Review" toggle in the Review section.
Note the current state of the toggle (on or off).
If the toggle is on, observe the sidebar and verify a "Review" item is visible.
Toggle the "Weekly Review" to off.
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Observe the sidebar.
Verify the "Review" item is no longer visible in the sidebar.
Toggle the "Weekly Review" back to on.
Wait for the auto-save to complete.
Verify the "Review" item reappears in the sidebar.
expected: Toggling the Weekly Review setting on shows the "Review" item in the sidebar. Toggling it off hides the "Review" item from the sidebar. The change takes effect immediately after auto-save completes.

name: About - Version and Debug Mode
preconditions: User is logged in. The settings page is open.
steps: Navigate to /settings.
Locate the About section.
Verify a version number is displayed (e.g., "v1.0.0" or similar).
Locate the "Debug Mode" toggle.
Verify Debug Mode is off by default.
Toggle Debug Mode on.
Verify a debug overlay appears on the screen showing: a. Application version. b. Base URL (API domain). c. Auth state (logged in/out, token info). d. Window dimensions (width x height).
Resize the browser window and verify the window dimensions update in real time.
Toggle Debug Mode off.
Verify the debug overlay disappears.
expected: The About section displays the application version. Enabling Debug Mode shows a persistent overlay with version, base URL, auth state, and window dimensions. The overlay updates dynamically. Disabling Debug Mode removes the overlay.

name: Quick Add Collapsed State
preconditions: User is logged in. The application is in its default state (Quick Add is not expanded).
steps: Log in and navigate to any page within the application.
Locate the Quick Add button in the top navigation bar.
Verify the button displays a "+" icon.
Verify the button displays the label "Quick Add" next to the icon.
On mobile (or using device emulation with a narrow viewport), verify the "Quick Add" text label is hidden and only the "+" icon is visible.
On desktop (wide viewport), verify both the "+" icon and the "Quick Add" label are visible.
expected: The Quick Add button is present in the top nav with a "+" icon. On desktop, the "Quick Add" label is visible alongside the icon. On mobile, only the "+" icon is shown (label hidden to save space).

name: Quick Add Expand
preconditions: User is logged in. Quick Add is in collapsed state.
steps: Locate the Quick Add button in the top navigation bar.
Click the Quick Add button.
Verify an input field appears (expanding from or replacing the button).
Verify the input field receives focus automatically (cursor is blinking inside the input).
Verify a placeholder text is shown in the input (e.g., "What's on your mind?" or similar).
expected: Clicking the Quick Add button reveals a text input field that is auto-focused. The input has placeholder text and is ready for the user to type immediately.

name: Quick Add Submit
preconditions: User is logged in. Quick Add is expanded and the input field is focused.
steps: Click the Quick Add button to expand it.
Type a title for a new item: "Buy groceries for dinner".
Press the Enter key.
Verify the input field clears (text is removed).
Verify the input field remains expanded and focused (stays open for multi-capture).
Navigate to /inbox.
Verify the item "Buy groceries for dinner" appears in the inbox list.
Navigate back to the previous page.
Type another title: "Call the dentist".
Press Enter.
Navigate to /inbox.
Verify "Call the dentist" also appears in the inbox.
expected: Pressing Enter submits the item title, which is added to the inbox as a new stuff item. The input clears but remains expanded and focused, allowing the user to quickly add multiple items in succession without re-opening Quick Add.

name: Quick Add Collapse
preconditions: User is logged in. Quick Add is expanded and the input field is focused.
steps: Click the Quick Add button to expand it.
Type some text: "Partial text".
Press the Escape key.
Verify the input text is cleared.
Verify the Quick Add collapses back to its button state.
Click the Quick Add button to expand it again.
Type some text: "More partial text".
Click somewhere outside the Quick Add input (blur the input).
Verify the input text is cleared.
Verify the Quick Add collapses back to its button state.
Navigate to /inbox and verify neither "Partial text" nor "More partial text" was added.
expected: Both pressing Escape and blurring the input cause the Quick Add to collapse and clear any entered text. No item is created from the unsaved text.

name: Quick Add Mobile Layout
preconditions: User is logged in. Viewing the application on a mobile device or using browser device emulation with a mobile viewport width (e.g., 375px).
steps: On a mobile viewport, locate the Quick Add "+" button in the top nav.
Tap the "+" button.
Verify the input field expands to fill the full width of the top navigation bar.
Verify the expanded input appears as a fixed-positioned overlay within the top nav area.
Verify the input is auto-focused and the keyboard opens (on a real device).
Type a title and press Enter (or the keyboard submit button).
Verify the item is added and the input clears.
Press Escape or tap outside to collapse.
Verify the Quick Add returns to its collapsed "+" icon state.
expected: On mobile, the Quick Add input expands to fill the entire top navigation width as a fixed-positioned overlay. It functions correctly for adding items and collapses properly.

name: Quick Add from Any Page
preconditions: User is logged in.
steps: Navigate to /next (Next Actions page).
Use Quick Add to add an item titled "Quick add from next page".
Navigate to /inbox and verify "Quick add from next page" appears there.
Navigate to /projects (Projects page).
Use Quick Add to add an item titled "Quick add from projects page".
Navigate to /inbox and verify "Quick add from projects page" appears there.
Navigate to /calendar (Calendar page).
Use Quick Add to add an item titled "Quick add from calendar page".
Navigate to /inbox and verify "Quick add from calendar page" appears there.
Navigate to /settings.
Use Quick Add to add an item titled "Quick add from settings page".
Navigate to /inbox and verify "Quick add from settings page" appears there.
expected: Regardless of which page the user is on, Quick Add always creates a new stuff item in the inbox. Items do not appear in the current page's list (unless the current page is the inbox) -- they always go to inbox as raw unclarified stuff.

name: Within-List Reorder - Desktop
preconditions: User is logged in on a desktop browser. A list (e.g., inbox) contains at least 3 items.
steps: Navigate to /inbox (or /next, /today, or another list view).
Verify there are at least 3 items: Item A (position 1), Item B (position 2), Item C (position 3).
Click and hold on Item A's drag handle (or the item itself if the entire row is draggable).
Drag Item A downward to position 3 (below Item C).
During the drag, verify a ghost placeholder appears at the target position indicating where the item will be placed.
During the drag, verify a smooth animation occurs (approximately 150ms transition).
Release the mouse button to drop Item A at position 3.
Verify the new order is: Item B (position 1), Item C (position 2), Item A (position 3).
Refresh the page.
Verify the new order persists after refresh (the reorder was saved to the server).
expected: Dragging an item within a list smoothly animates (150ms) and shows a ghost placeholder at the drop position. The new order is applied immediately and persisted to the server.

name: Within-List Reorder - Touch
preconditions: User is logged in on a touch device (or using touch emulation). A list contains at least 3 items.
steps: Navigate to /inbox (or another list view) on a touch device.
Verify there are at least 3 items in the list.
Long-press (touch and hold for at least 150ms) on an item.
After the long-press delay, verify the item enters drag mode (visual feedback such as lifting or shadow).
While still touching, drag the item to a new position.
Verify the ghost placeholder and animation work similarly to desktop.
Release the touch to drop the item.
Verify the item is in its new position.
Refresh the page and verify the new order persists.
expected: Long-pressing (150ms delay) on a touch device initiates drag mode. The item can be dragged to a new position with visual feedback. The reorder is saved and persists after refresh.

name: Cross-Component Drag to Sidebar Destinations
preconditions: User is logged in on desktop. The sidebar is visible. A list (e.g., inbox) contains at least one item.
steps: Navigate to /inbox.
Click and hold on an item in the list.
Drag the item to the "Next" item in the sidebar.
Verify the sidebar "Next" item highlights as a valid drop target.
Drop the item on "Next".
Verify the item is removed from the inbox and moved to the Next Actions list.
Navigate to /next and verify the item appears there.
Repeat the process by dragging an item from a list to "Today" in the sidebar. Verify the item moves to Today.
Repeat by dragging an item to "Someday" in the sidebar. Verify the item moves to Someday.
Repeat by dragging an item to "Completed" in the sidebar. Verify the item is marked as completed.
Repeat by dragging an item to "Trash" in the sidebar. Verify the item is moved to trash.
expected: Items can be dragged from any list and dropped onto sidebar navigation items (Next, Today, Someday, Completed, Trash) to move or transition the item accordingly. The sidebar item highlights as a valid drop target during hover.

name: Cross-Component Drag to Calendar Sidebar
preconditions: User is logged in on desktop. The sidebar is visible. A list contains at least one item.
steps: Navigate to /inbox or /next.
Click and hold on an item in the list.
Drag the item to the "Calendar" item in the sidebar.
Verify the sidebar "Calendar" item highlights as a valid drop target.
Drop the item on "Calendar".
Verify a date/time modal opens, prompting the user to select a date and optionally a time for the item.
Select a date (e.g., tomorrow) and optionally a time (e.g., 10:00 AM).
Confirm the selection.
Verify the item is moved to the calendar with the specified date/time.
Navigate to /calendar and verify the item appears on the selected date.
expected: Dropping an item on the Calendar sidebar item opens a date/time selection modal. After selecting a date and confirming, the item is assigned that date and appears in the calendar view.

name: Cross-Component Drag to Waiting For Sidebar
preconditions: User is logged in on desktop. The sidebar is visible. A list contains at least one item.
steps: Navigate to /inbox or /next.
Click and hold on an item in the list.
Drag the item to the "Waiting For" item in the sidebar.
Verify the sidebar "Waiting For" item highlights as a valid drop target.
Drop the item on "Waiting For".
Verify a waiting-for modal opens, prompting the user to specify who/what the item is waiting for.
Fill in the waiting-for details (e.g., "John to review the proposal").
Confirm the selection.
Verify the item is moved to the Waiting For list with the specified delegation info.
expected: Dropping an item on the Waiting For sidebar item opens a modal for specifying waiting-for details. After confirming, the item is assigned the waiting_for attribute and appears in the Waiting For view.

name: Cross-Component Drag to Projects Sidebar
preconditions: User is logged in on desktop. The sidebar is visible. A list contains at least one item.
steps: Navigate to /inbox or /next.
Click and hold on an item in the list.
Drag the item to the "Projects" item in the sidebar.
Verify the sidebar "Projects" item highlights as a valid drop target.
Drop the item on "Projects".
Verify an outcome modal opens, prompting the user to define the project outcome or select an existing project.
Enter a project outcome (e.g., "Plan team offsite").
Confirm the selection.
Verify the item is transformed into or associated with a project.
Navigate to /projects and verify the project appears.
expected: Dropping an item on the Projects sidebar item opens an outcome modal for defining or selecting a project. After confirming, the item is associated with the project and appears in the Projects view.

name: Cross-Component Drag to Reference Sidebar
preconditions: User is logged in on desktop. The sidebar is visible. The inbox contains at least one stuff item and the next list contains at least one action.
steps: Navigate to /inbox.
Click and hold on a stuff item.
Drag the stuff item to the "Reference" item in the sidebar.
Verify the sidebar "Reference" item highlights as a valid drop target.
Drop the stuff item on "Reference".
Verify the stuff item is accepted and moved to the Reference view.
Navigate to /reference and verify the item appears there.
Navigate to /next.
Click and hold on an action item.
Drag the action item to the "Reference" item in the sidebar.
Verify the drop is rejected (e.g., the "Reference" item does not highlight, or a visual rejection indicator appears).
Release the item.
Verify the action item remains in its original position in the next list.
expected: Stuff items can be dragged to Reference and are accepted. Action items dragged to Reference are rejected because actions are actionable items and cannot be stored as reference material. The rejection is visually indicated.

name: Drag Hint on First Visit
